I realize that Solaris 9 Early Access doesn't exactly count as an Eclipse
supported platform at present, but just as a heads up...  Eclipse dies
reproducibly on Solaris 9 EA, apparently because of a limitation in SWT's
parsing of font descriptors (I think).

There seem to be multiple ways to tickle this, but one reliable way to 
crash it is to bring up Eclipse, then in the resource Navigator view
select the Menu and then "Filters..."

The configuration that I was using -- Ultra 10 with a Creator3D and 24-bit
default visuals, with Sun JDK 1.3.1 and the stable Eclipse 20020125 build --
is the same setup that I previously used successfully with Solaris 8;
as far as I know, the only thing that I changed is the Solaris version.

I also tried both 8-bit visuals (the Eclipse splash screen looks impressively
awful) and JDK 1.4 Beta 3, but got the same results in all cases -- now that
I've upgraded this box to Solaris 9 EA I can't run Eclipse on it.  Good thing
it's my home machine, where I was only playing around with Eclipse anyway.
